definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Most people, looking at a newly-ploughed field, simply see a barren landscape.
sentences.chinese: 大多數人在面對新開荒的地域時，只看到一片荒蕪。

sentences.english: Open up wasteland without tools how to do?

definition: to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
to be of no interest to anyone (idiom)
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
